intro: Rubus dumetorum subf. pilifer, commonly known as the woolly blackberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and thorny stems, which provide protection against herbivores. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark red to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
